ground_truth: The newlyweds' apartment has the shades still drawn, although there's a light burning inside. Jeff has a slight, but warm, smile on his face as he looks at the drawn shade. His eyes move away from the newlyweds' apartment and slowly explore the neighborhood to his right. His face sobers at what he sees. He finds something of interest and stops to stare at it. The salesman has prepared a dinner tray and is carrying it from the kitchen, through the living room, into the bedroom, in his apartment where we see both the living room and the bedroom. He places it on the lap of his wife, sitting up in bed, and puts a couple of pillows behind her back to make her more comfortable. Her attitude shows her dissatisfaction, and she begins criticizing him. He starts to answer her back but decides better of it and instead leaves the room. The wife grudgingly begins to eat the dinner. The husband quietly lifts a phone from the cradle and dials a number. Quietly, she moves the tray, gets out of bed, and goes to the bedroom door to listen. He goes to the kitchen, reaches up to a wall cabinet, takes down a bottle, and pours himself a drink. In the bedroom, his wife becomes aware of the call, and instantly there is a marked change in his attitude. We get a better view of the salesman waiting while his connection is being made. He relaxes, smiles, and is warm. Whoever he has called answers. He talks softly, perhaps guardedly, with an occasional glance at the bedroom door. Jeff becomes completely absorbed with what he sees and leans forward a little. The wall hides her from our view. Then suddenly, she apparently opens the door because, in the living room, we see her arm suddenly appear, pointing at the man and the telephone. He speaks quickly into the phone and hangs up. His face is flushed and angry as he goes toward the bedroom. In the bedroom, his wife appears walking back to the bed, followed by the husband. She is laughing, and he is answering her in angry tones. The more she laughs, the more angry he gets, and the harder she laughs. She climbs in bed laughing. Finally, he leaves the room, goes into the living room, back into the kitchen, and has another drink. He turns his eyes in the direction of the composer's apartment. Through the studio window of the songwriter's apartment, we see the man at work again on his original melody, and he is farther along the line of the melody than before. Lisa is emerging from the kitchen, carrying the serving dish of their lobster thermidor.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution

His eyes move away from the newlyweds' flat and slowly explore the district to his right. His visage sobers at what he sees. He finds something of interest and stops to gaze at it. The spouse grudgingly begins to eat the meal. The husband quietly lifts a handset from the cradle and dials a numeral. In the chamber, his spouse becomes aware of the call, and instantly there is a marked change in his demeanor. We get a better view of the vendor waiting while his connection is being made. He relaxes, grins, and is warm. Whoever he has called answers. He talks softly, perhaps guardedly, with an occasional glance at the chamber door. Jeff becomes completely absorbed with what he sees and leans forward a little. The wall hides her from our view. Then suddenly, she apparently opens the door because, in the lounge, we see her arm suddenly appear, pointing at the man and the handset. He speaks quickly into the handset and hangs up. His visage is flushed and irate as he goes toward the chamber. In the chamber, his spouse appears walking back to the bed, followed by the husband. She is laughing, and he is answering her in irate tones. The more she laughs, the more irate he gets, and the harder she laughs. She climbs in bed laughing. Finally, he leaves the space, goes into the lounge, back into the galley, and has another beverage. He turns his eyes in the direction of the composer's flat. Through the studio window of the songwriter's flat, we see the man at work again on his original tune, and he is farther along the line of the tune than before. test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The shades in the newlyweds' apartment are still drawn, although a light is burning inside. A slight, but warm, smile is on Jeff's face as he looks at the drawn shade. His eyes are moved away from the newlyweds' apartment and slowly the neighborhood to his right is explored by him. His face is sobered at what he sees. Something of interest is found by him, and he stops to stare at it. A dinner tray has been prepared by the salesman and is being carried from the kitchen, through the living room, into the bedroom, where both the living room and the bedroom can be seen in his apartment. It is placed on the lap of his wife, who is sitting up in bed, and a couple of pillows are put behind her back by him to make her more comfortable. Dissatisfaction is shown by her attitude, and she begins criticizing him. He starts to answer her back but decides better of it and instead the room is left by him. The dinner is grudgingly begun by the wife. The phone is quietly lifted from the cradle by the husband, and he dials a number. The tray is moved by her quietly, she gets out of bed, and the bedroom door is approached by her to listen. The kitchen is reached by him, a wall cabinet is opened, a bottle is taken down, and a drink is poured for himself. In the bedroom, the call is noticed by his wife, and instantly a marked change in his attitude occurs. A better view of the salesman is given as he waits for his connection to be made. He relaxes, smiles, and is warm. Whoever he has called is answered. He talks softly, perhaps guardedly, with an occasional glance at the bedroom door. Jeff is completely absorbed by what he sees and leans forward a little. She is hidden from our view by the wall. Then suddenly, the door is apparently opened by her because, in the living room, her arm suddenly appears, pointing at the man and the telephone. He quickly speaks into the phone and hangs it up. His face, flushed and angry, goes toward the bedroom. In the bedroom, she appears walking back to the bed, followed by him. She is laughing, and angry tones are used by him to answer her. The more she laughs, the angrier he gets, and the harder she laughs. She climbs into bed laughing. Finally, the room is left by him, he goes into the living room, back into the kitchen, and another drink is had by him. His eyes are turned in the direction of the composer's apartment. Through the studio window of the songwriter's apartment, the man is seen at work again on his original melody, and farther along the line of the melody than before is he. The serving dish of their lobster thermidor is being carried by Lisa as she emerges from the kitchen.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The newlyweds' apartment has the shades drawn, but a light is on inside. Jeff smiles slightly as he looks at the shade, then scans the neighborhood to his right, his expression changing. He notices something and stares. The salesman carries a dinner tray from the kitchen to the bedroom, where his wife sits up in bed. He places the tray on her lap and adjusts pillows for comfort. She shows dissatisfaction and criticizes him. He starts to respond but refrains and leaves. She grudgingly eats. The husband quietly dials a number, while she moves the tray, gets out of bed, and listens at the door. He pours a drink in the kitchen. She notices the call, and his demeanor changes. The salesman waits for the connection, relaxes, and smiles. He speaks softly, glancing at the door. Jeff is absorbed in watching. Suddenly, her arm appears in the living room, pointing at him and the phone. He quickly ends the call, angry, and heads to the bedroom. She returns to bed, laughing, as he follows, angry. Her laughter increases his anger. She climbs into bed, still laughing. He leaves, goes to the kitchen, and drinks again. He looks toward the composer's apartment, where the songwriter works on his melody, progressing further. Lisa emerges from the kitchen with their lobster thermidor.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The newlyweds' apartment has shades drawn, but a light is on. Jeff smiles slightly at the shade, then looks around the neighborhood, his expression changing. He notices something and stares. A salesman carries a dinner tray from the kitchen to his wife in bed, making her comfortable. She criticizes him, and he leaves the room. She reluctantly eats while he quietly makes a phone call. She listens at the door as he pours a drink. A change occurs when she realizes the call, and he relaxes, smiling. Jeff is intrigued. Suddenly, she points at him and the phone. He quickly hangs up, angry, and confronts her. She laughs, angering him more. He leaves, drinks again, and looks toward the composer's apartment. The songwriter works on his melody, progressing. Lisa emerges with their lobster thermidor.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The apartment belonging to the newlyweds still has its shades drawn tightly, even though there is a light shining brightly inside, casting a warm glow. Jeff, with a slight yet genuinely warm smile gracing his face, gazes thoughtfully at the drawn shade. His eyes then drift away from the newlyweds' apartment, slowly and deliberately exploring the neighborhood to his right. His expression changes, becoming more serious and sober as he takes in the scene before him. Something catches his interest, and he pauses, fixated on whatever it is that has drawn his attention. 

Meanwhile, in another apartment, the salesman has carefully prepared a dinner tray. He carries it from the kitchen, through the living room, and into the bedroom, where we have a clear view of both the living room and the bedroom. He gently places the tray on the lap of his wife, who is sitting up in bed, and thoughtfully arranges a couple of pillows behind her back to ensure she is more comfortable. Her demeanor, however, reveals her dissatisfaction, and she begins to criticize him. He starts to respond to her criticisms but thinks better of it, choosing instead to leave the room. The wife, albeit grudgingly, begins to eat the dinner that has been prepared for her. 

The husband, moving quietly, lifts the phone from its cradle and dials a number. Meanwhile, she discreetly moves the tray aside, gets out of bed, and approaches the bedroom door to listen in on his conversation. He makes his way to the kitchen, reaches up to a wall cabinet, retrieves a bottle, and pours himself a drink. In the bedroom, his wife becomes aware of the phone call, and there is an immediate and noticeable change in his demeanor. We get a clearer view of the salesman as he waits for his call to connect. He relaxes, his face softening into a smile, exuding warmth. The person he has called answers, and he speaks softly, perhaps with a hint of caution, occasionally glancing at the bedroom door. 

Jeff is completely absorbed by what he observes and leans forward slightly, his curiosity piqued. The wall obscures her from our view. Suddenly, she apparently opens the door, for in the living room, we see her arm appear abruptly, pointing accusingly at the man and the telephone. He speaks quickly into the phone and then hangs up. His face is flushed with anger as he heads toward the bedroom. In the bedroom, his wife is seen walking back to the bed, with the husband following closely behind. She is laughing, and he responds to her with angry tones. The more she laughs, the angrier he becomes, and the harder she laughs. She climbs into bed, still laughing. Finally, he exits the room, moves into the living room, and returns to the kitchen for another drink. 

He then turns his gaze toward the composer's apartment. Through the studio window of the songwriter's apartment, we can see the man diligently at work once more on his original melody, and he has progressed further along the line of the melody than before. Lisa emerges from the kitchen, carrying the serving dish of their lobster thermidor, adding to the scene unfolding around them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The cozy apartment belonging to the newlywed couple remains with its shades drawn tightly shut, even though there is a light glowing brightly inside. This light casts a soft, warm glow throughout the interior. Jeff, sporting a slight yet genuinely warm smile that graces his face, gazes thoughtfully at the drawn shade of the newlyweds' apartment. His eyes eventually drift away in a slow, deliberate manner, exploring the neighborhood scene to his right. As he absorbs the surroundings, his expression shifts, becoming more serious and sober while he takes in the scene before him. Something in the area catches his interest, drawing his full attention, and he pauses, fixated on whatever it is that has captured his interest. 

Meanwhile, in another nearby apartment, the diligent salesman has carefully prepared a dinner tray. He carries this tray from the kitchen, through the expanse of the living room, and into the bedroom. From our vantage point, we have a clear view of both the living room and the bedroom. The salesman gently places the tray on his wife's lap, as she sits propped up in bed, and thoughtfully arranges a pair of pillows behind her back, ensuring she is made more comfortable. However, her demeanor reveals her dissatisfaction, and she begins to criticize him. The salesman starts to respond to these criticisms but reconsiders, ultimately choosing to leave the room instead. Although begrudgingly, the wife begins to eat the dinner that has been so thoughtfully prepared for her. 

The husband moves quietly and discreetly, lifting the phone from its cradle to dial a number. Meanwhile, she carefully moves the tray to the side, gets out of the bed, and approaches the bedroom door to clandestinely listen in on his conversation. The husband makes his way to the kitchen, reaching up to a wall cabinet to retrieve a bottle, from which he pours himself a drink. In the bedroom, his wife becomes aware of the phone call taking place, and there is an immediate and noticeable change in his demeanor. We get a clearer view of the salesman as he patiently waits for his call to connect. He relaxes, his face softening into a gentle smile, exuding warmth. Once the person he has called answers, he speaks softly, perhaps with a hint of caution, while he occasionally glances at the bedroom door. 

Jeff remains completely absorbed by what he observes and leans forward slightly, his curiosity noticeably piqued. The wall obscures her from our view, but suddenly, it appears that she opens the door, for in the living room, we see her arm appear abruptly. Her arm extends outward, pointing accusingly at the man and the telephone. He quickly speaks into the phone and then hangs up. His face is flushed with anger as he heads toward the bedroom. Within the bedroom, his wife is seen walking back to the bed, with the husband closely following behind. She is laughing heartily, and he responds to her with tones filled with anger. The more she laughs, the angrier he becomes, only intensifying her laughter. She climbs back into bed, still laughing loudly. Finally, he exits the room, moves back into the living room, and returns to the kitchen for yet another drink. 

He then shifts his gaze toward the apartment of the composer. Through the studio window of the songwriter's apartment, we can observe the man diligently at work once more on his original melody. He has made noticeable progress, advancing further along the lines of the melody than he had before. Lisa emerges from the kitchen, carrying the serving dish of their lobster thermidor, adding a final touch to the unfolding scene around them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The newlyweds' apartment remains with the shades drawn, yet a light glows softly inside, casting a warm ambiance. Jeff, standing nearby, wears a slight but genuinely warm smile as he gazes at the drawn shade, his expression reflecting a sense of contentment. His eyes gradually shift away from the newlyweds' apartment, and he begins to slowly scan the neighborhood to his right, taking in the various sights and sounds around him. As his gaze travels, his face gradually sobers, reflecting a change in his mood as he observes something that captures his attention. He finds something intriguing and comes to a halt, his eyes fixed intently on the object of his interest. Meanwhile, in another apartment, the salesman has meticulously prepared a dinner tray, carefully arranging the items before lifting it from the kitchen counter. He carries the tray with deliberate steps, moving through the living room and into the bedroom, where both rooms are visible to us. Upon reaching the bedroom, he gently places the tray on the lap of his wife, who is sitting up in bed, and thoughtfully arranges a couple of pillows behind her back to ensure her comfort. Despite his efforts, her demeanor reveals her dissatisfaction, and she begins to criticize him, her words sharp and pointed. He initially starts to respond, his voice rising in defense, but then he pauses, reconsiders, and chooses to leave the room instead, opting for silence over confrontation. Left alone, the wife reluctantly begins to eat the dinner, her movements slow and grudging. Meanwhile, the husband quietly approaches the phone, lifts it from the cradle, and dials a number with a sense of purpose. As he does so, she discreetly moves the tray aside, slips out of bed, and tiptoes to the bedroom door, her curiosity piqued as she listens intently. In the kitchen, he reaches up to a wall cabinet, retrieves a bottle, and pours himself a drink, the liquid splashing softly into the glass. Back in the bedroom, the wife becomes acutely aware of the phone call, and a noticeable shift occurs in her demeanor. We gain a clearer view of the salesman as he waits for his call to connect, his posture relaxing, a smile spreading across his face, exuding warmth. The person on the other end answers, and he begins to speak softly, his tone perhaps guarded, occasionally glancing toward the bedroom door as if wary of being overheard. Jeff, observing from a distance, becomes completely engrossed in the unfolding scene, leaning forward slightly to get a better view. The wall obscures the wife from our sight, but suddenly, she apparently opens the door, and in the living room, her arm appears abruptly, pointing accusingly at the man and the telephone. He reacts quickly, speaking hastily into the phone before hanging up, his face flushed with anger as he strides toward the bedroom. Inside the bedroom, his wife is seen walking back to the bed, her laughter ringing out, followed closely by the husband, whose voice is raised in angry retorts. The more she laughs, the angrier he becomes, his frustration mounting with each peal of her laughter. She climbs back into bed, still laughing, her amusement undiminished. Finally, he storms out of the room, his temper unabated, and retreats to the living room, then back into the kitchen, where he pours himself another drink, seeking solace in the familiar ritual. His gaze shifts toward the composer's apartment, where, through the studio window, we observe the songwriter diligently at work, progressing further along the melody he had been crafting earlier. Meanwhile, Lisa emerges gracefully from the kitchen, carrying the serving dish of their lobster thermidor, her movements fluid and purposeful.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The newlyweds' apartment remains dimly lit with shades drawn, while Jeff observes with a slight, warm smile before scanning the neighborhood to his right, where his expression turns serious. He focuses on the salesman, who carries a dinner tray from the kitchen to the bedroom, placing it on his wife's lap and adjusting pillows for her comfort. Despite his efforts, she criticizes him, prompting him to initially respond but then choose to leave the room. She reluctantly starts eating as he quietly makes a phone call from the kitchen, pouring himself a drink. His demeanor changes to relaxed and warm as he converses softly, occasionally glancing at the bedroom door. Jeff becomes engrossed in the scene, leaning forward. The wife, aware of the call, suddenly points at him from the living room, prompting him to quickly end the call, visibly angry. He confronts her in the bedroom, where her laughter intensifies his anger. She continues laughing as she returns to bed, and he storms out to the kitchen for another drink. His attention shifts to the composer's apartment, where the songwriter is progressing on his melody. Meanwhile, Lisa emerges from the kitchen with their lobster thermidor.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The newlyweds' apartment, located in a vibrant urban area known for its eclectic mix of residents, has the shades still drawn, although there's a light burning inside. Jeff, known in the neighborhood as a keen observer of people and their stories, has a slight, but warm, smile on his face as he looks at the drawn shade. His eyes move away from the newlyweds' apartment and slowly explore the neighborhood to his right, which is lined with a variety of charming brownstones and lively street vendors. His face sobers at what he sees, perhaps noticing the stark contrast between the lively street life and the quiet apartment windows. He finds something of interest and stops to stare at it, possibly a street entertainer drawing a small crowd. The salesman, a man who prides himself on his culinary skills, has prepared a dinner tray and is carrying it from the kitchen, through the living room, into the bedroom, in his apartment where we see both the living room and the bedroom designed in a mid-century modern style. He places it on the lap of his wife, sitting up in bed, and puts a couple of pillows behind her back to make her more comfortable. Her attitude shows her dissatisfaction, and she begins criticizing him, a common dynamic in their five-year marriage. He starts to answer her back but decides better of it, a tactic he learned from a self-help book on improving marital communication, and instead leaves the room. The wife grudgingly begins to eat the dinner, which features expertly cooked salmon and steamed vegetables. The husband quietly lifts a phone from the cradle and dials a number, perhaps calling a confidant whom he often turns to for advice. Quietly, she moves the tray, gets out of bed, and goes to the bedroom door to listen. He goes to the kitchen, reaches up to a wall cabinet where he keeps his collection of fine spirits, takes down a bottle, and pours himself a drink. In the bedroom, his wife becomes aware of the call, and instantly there is a marked change in his attitude, suggesting the call is significant. We get a better view of the salesman waiting while his connection is being made, possibly to a business partner overseas. He relaxes, smiles, and is warm. Whoever he has called answers. He talks softly, perhaps guardedly, with an occasional glance at the bedroom door. Jeff becomes completely absorbed with what he sees and leans forward a little, his curiosity piqued by the unfolding drama. The wall hides her from our view. Then suddenly, she apparently opens the door because, in the living room, we see her arm suddenly appear, pointing at the man and the telephone. He speaks quickly into the phone and hangs up, the call seemingly more urgent than before. His face is flushed and angry as he goes toward the bedroom. In the bedroom, his wife appears walking back to the bed, followed by the husband. She is laughing, and he is answering her in angry tones, a familiar exchange that neighbors often overhear. The more she laughs, the more angry he gets, and the harder she laughs. She climbs in bed laughing. Finally, he leaves the room, goes into the living room, back into the kitchen, and has another drink, trying to calm his nerves with his favorite bourbon. He turns his eyes in the direction of the composer's apartment. Through the studio window of the songwriter's apartment, we see the man at work again on his original melody, and he is farther along the line of the melody than before, an intricately woven tune inspired by the rhythms of the nearby bustling city. Lisa, Jeff's longtime girlfriend and known for her culinary prowess, is emerging from the kitchen, carrying the serving dish of their lobster thermidor, a recipe she perfected during a cooking course in Paris.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. He relaxes smiles and is warm. Whoever he has called answers. He talks softly perhaps guardedly with an occasional glance at the bedroom door. Jeff becomes completely absorbed with what he sees and leans forward a little. The wall hides her from our view. Then suddenly she apparently opens the door because in the living room we see her arm suddenly appear pointing at the man and the telephone. He speaks quickly into the phone and hangs up. His face is flushed and angry as he goes toward the bedroom. In the bedroom his wife appears walking back to the bed followed by the husband. She is laughing and he is answering her in angry tones. The more she laughs the more angry he gets and the harder she laughs. She climbs in bed laughing. Finally he leaves the room goes into the living room back into the kitchen and has another drink. He turns his eyes in the direction of the composer's apartment. Through the studio window of the songwriter's apartment we see the man at work again on his original melody and he is farther along the line of the melody than before. Lisa is emerging from the kitchen carrying the serving dish of their lobster thermidor.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The newlyweds' apartment has the shades still drawn although there is a light burning inside. Jeff has a slight but warm smile on his face as he looks at the drawn shade. His eyes move away from the newlyweds' apartment and slowly explore the neighborhood to his right. His face sobers at what he sees. He finds something of interest and stops to stare at it. The salesman has prepared a dinner tray and is carrying it from the kitchen through the living room into the bedroom. in his apartment where we see both the living room and the bedroom. He places it on the lap of his wife sitting up in bed and puts a couple of pillows behind her back to make her more comfortable. In the bedroom his wife appears walking back to the bed followed by the husband. She is laughing and he is answering her in angry tones. The more she laughs the more angry he gets and the harder she laughs. She climbs in bed laughing. Finally he leaves the room goes into the living room back into the kitchen and has another drink. He turns his eyes in the direction of the composer's apartment. Through the studio window of the songwriter's apartment we see the man at work again on his original melody and he is farther along the line of the melody than before. Lisa is emerging from the kitchen carrying the serving dish of their lobster thermidor.

His eyes move away from the newlyweds' apartment and slowly explore the neighborhood to his right. His face sobers at what he sees. He turns his eyes in the direction of the composer's apartment. Through the studio window of the songwriter's apartment we see the man at work again on his original melody and he is farther along the line of the melody than before. Lisa is emerging from the kitchen carrying the serving dish of their lobster thermidor.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The spelunkers' cave has the curtains still open, although there's a candle flickering outside. Bob has a broad, but chilly, grin on his legs as he glances at the open curtain. His elbows shift away from the spelunkers' cave and rapidly examine the forest to his left. His torso brightens at what he finds. He discovers something peculiar and begins to whistle at it. The artist has created a paint palette and is dragging it from the garage, through the corridor, into the gallery, in her house where we observe both the corridor and the gallery. She throws it on the lap of her cat, sprawled out on the couch, and tosses a pile of quilts behind its paws to make it more irritated. Its aura displays its joy, and it starts praising her. It attempts to hiss at her but chooses otherwise and instead hops out the window. The cat lazily starts to paw at the palette. The owner loudly grabs a guitar from the stand and strums a song. Loudly, it maneuvers the palette, leaps off the couch, and climbs to the gallery window to snooze. She rushes to the garage, reaches over to a floor cupboard, pulls out a paintbrush, and starts a picture. In the gallery, her cat detects the tune, and abruptly there is a vivid shift in its aura. We catch a clearer glimpse of the artist resting while her piece is being finished. She fidgets, frowns, and is calm. Whoever she has serenaded listens. She hums loudly, perhaps openly, with a frequent glance at the gallery window. Bob becomes partially engrossed with what he hears and leans backward a lot. The tree shields it from our sight. Then suddenly, it evidently closes the window because, in the corridor, we notice its tail quickly vanish, pointing at the girl and the guitar. She yells calmly into the guitar and sets it aside. Its face is calm and joyful as it skips toward the gallery. In the gallery, her cat appears leaping back to the couch, followed by the owner. It is yawning, and she is hushing it in joyful tones. The more it yawns, the more joyful she becomes, and the quieter it yawns. It rests on the couch yawning. Finally, she skips from the gallery, prances into the corridor, back into the garage, and starts another picture. She tilts her elbows in the direction of the zookeeper's cave. Through the attic window of the gardener's cave, we observe the woman at play again on her unique composition, and she is further down the path of the composition than earlier. Mark is slipping out of the garage, pushing the bowl of their apple pie.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The shades remain drawn in the newlyweds' apartment, but a light is on. Jeff watches with a warm smile, then shifts his gaze to the neighborhood, his expression sobering. In another apartment, a salesman serves dinner to his wife in bed, who responds with dissatisfaction. As he retreats, she listens to him make a phone call. The salesman, now relaxed, smiles while speaking softly on the phone, occasionally glancing towards the bedroom door. Jeff becomes engrossed in the scene. The wife points at him, prompting him to end the call angrily. She laughs, provoking his anger, and he exits for another drink. His gaze turns towards the composer's apartment, where the musician progresses on a melody. Meanwhile, Lisa carries a dish of lobster thermidor from the kitchen.
